eqnarray\*:
\begin{eqnarray*}
&& \hspace*{-8mm}
A_k \equiv \sum_{i=1}^{K} a_i^k, \quad 
B_k \equiv \sum_{i=1}^{J-1} b_i^k, \quad 
C_k \equiv \sum_{i=1}^{K+L-R-2} c_i^k, \quad 
D_k \equiv \sum_{i=1}^{L} d_i^k, \quad 
E_k \equiv \sum_{i=1}^{R} e_i^k, \quad
F_k \equiv \sum_{i=1}^{J} f_i^k, 
\nonumber \\
&& \hspace*{-8mm}
T_k \equiv B_k + C_k + E_k - A_k - D_k - F_k, \quad
U_k \equiv F_k - B_k, \quad
W_k \equiv C_k - D_k. 
\end{eqnarray*}
Some results for separate terms 
of expansion~(\ref{expansion}) are collected in Section~2.1. 

%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
For the sums of the type~(\ref{binsum}) with an arbitrary integer power 
$c\geq 2$  and  $0 \leq u \leq 4$, the following one-fold integral 
representation \cite{BBK} is useful:
\begin{eqnarray}
\sum_{j=1}^\infty  \frac{u^j}{j^c} \frac{f(j)}{\left( 2j\atop j\right)} =
\frac{1}{(c-2)!} \int\limits_0^{\theta}
{\rm d}\phi \frac{\cos {\textstyle{\frac{\phi}{2}}}}{\sin{\textstyle{\frac{\phi}{2}}}}
\Bigl[\ln{u} - 2\ln \left(2 \sin {\textstyle{\frac{\phi}{2}}} \right)\Bigr]^{c-2} 
\sum_{j=1}^\infty \frac{\left( 4 \sin^2{\textstyle{\frac{\phi}{2}}} \right)^{j}}{j} 
\frac{f(j)}{\left( 2j\atop j\right)}  \; ,
\label{higher_c}
\end{eqnarray}
where $f(j)$ stands for an arbitrary combination of the harmonic sums.
In this manner, the original sum of the type~(\ref{binsum}) 
with an arbitrary positive integer parameter $c\geq 2$ is reduced
to a one-fold integral representation containing
a sum with $c=1$ in the integrand. 
Using the representation~(\ref{higher_c}) we can generalize our 
results~(\ref{S2}), (\ref{S4}), (\ref{S1a})--(\ref{last4})
to the case of an arbitrary integer $c>1$.
However, only for special types of sums these results are 
expressible in terms of generalized log-sine functions~(\ref{def_Ls}):
\begin{eqnarray}
&& \hspace*{-7mm}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\sum_{j=1}^\infty  \frac{u^j}{j^c} \frac{1}{\left( 2j\atop j\right)} S_2 =
- {\textstyle{\frac{1}{6}}} \sum_{i=0}^{c-2} \frac{(-2)^i}{i!(c-2-i)!} 
\left(\ln u \right)^{c-2-i} {\mbox{Ls}}_{i+4}^{(3)}\left(\theta\right) \;, 
\label{S2G}
\\ && \hspace*{-7mm}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\sum_{j=1}^\infty  \frac{u^j}{j^c} \frac{1}{\left( 2j\atop j\right)}
\left( S_2^2-S_4 \right) =
- {\textstyle{\frac{1}{60}}} \sum_{i=0}^{c-2} \frac{(-2)^i}{i!(c-2-i)!} 
\left(\ln u \right)^{c-2-i} {\mbox{Ls}}_{i+6}^{(5)}\left(\theta\right) \;, 
\label{S4G}
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\end{eqnarray}
where $c \geq 2$, $0 \leq u \leq 4$, and the angle $\theta$ is
defined in Eq.~(\ref{def_theta}). 

Further results can be extracted 
from integral representation~(\ref{higher_c}) by using 
the integration rules for Clausen's function~\cite{Lewin} and 
the following relation:
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\[
k \int\limits_0^\theta {\rm d}\phi\;
{\phi}^{k-1} {\mbox{Ls}}_{j}^{(i)}\left(m \phi\right)
=  \theta^k {\mbox{Ls}}_{j}^{(i)}\left(m\theta\right) - \frac{1}{m^k} {\mbox{Ls}}_{j+k}^{(i+k)}\left(m \theta\right)
\; . 
\]
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
In this way, we obtain 
\begin{eqnarray}
\label{S1c2}
\sum_{j=1}^\infty \frac{1}{\left( 2j \atop j\right) } 
\frac{u^j}{j^2} S_1   &=&  
  4 {\mbox{Cl}}_{3}\left(\pi - \theta\right) - 2 \theta {\mbox{Cl}}_{2}\left(\pi - \theta\right) + 3 \zeta_3 , 
\\ 
\sum_{j=1}^\infty \frac{1}{\left( 2j \atop j \right) } 
\frac{u^j}{j^2} \bar{S}_1
 &=&  -2 {\mbox{Cl}}_{3}\left(\theta\right) + 4  {\mbox{Cl}}_{3}\left(\pi-\theta\right)
- 2 \theta {\mbox{Cl}}_{2}\left(\pi- \theta\right)
-   \theta {\mbox{Cl}}_{2}\left(\theta\right)
+ 5 \zeta_3 \; , \hspace*{10mm}
\\ 
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\sum_{j=1}^\infty \frac{1}{\left( 2j\atop j\right)} 
\frac{u^j}{j^2} S_1^2 
&=&  
4 \theta \left[ {\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(\pi-\theta\right) - {\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(\pi\right) \right]
-  4\left[ {\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\pi-\theta\right) \right]^2
+ {\textstyle{\frac{1}{24}}} \theta^4 \; ,
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\\  
\sum_{j=1}^\infty \frac{1}{\left( 2j \atop j\right) } 
      \frac{u^j}{j^2} S_1 \bar{S}_1
&=& 
 5 \theta \left[{\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(\pi-\theta\right) - {\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(\pi\right) \right]
- \theta {\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(\theta\right) 
+ {\textstyle{\frac{1}{2}}} \theta {\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(2 \theta\right)
\nonumber \\ && 
- 4 \left[{\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\pi-\theta\right) \right]^2
+ {\textstyle{\frac{1}{48}}} \theta^4 
- 2 {\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\pi-\theta\right)  {\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\theta\right) \; , 
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
\\  
\sum_{j=1}^\infty \frac{1}{\left( 2j \atop j\right) } 
\frac{u^j}{j^2} 
\left( \bar{S}_1^2 + \bar{S}_2 \right)
&=& 
  6 \theta \left[{\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(\pi-\theta\right) - {\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(\pi\right) \right]
- 3 \theta {\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(\theta\right)
+  \theta {\mbox{Ls}}_{3}\left(2 \theta\right)
\nonumber \\ &&
- 4 \left[{\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\pi-\theta\right) \right]^2
- \left[{\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\theta\right) \right]^2
+ {\textstyle{\frac{1}{48}}} \theta^4
- 4 {\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\pi-\theta\right)  {\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\theta\right) \; .
\label{S2bar_2}
\end{eqnarray}

However, other sums are not expressible in terms of 
the generalized log-sine functions.
One needs to introduce a new function\footnote{Alternatively,
instead of $\Phi(\theta)$ one may introduce the generalized
Glashier function ${\mbox{Gl}}_{4}\left(\theta;1\right)$, see Eq.~(\ref{Gl4(theta,1)}) 
in Appendix~A.},
\begin{equation}
\label{def_Phi}
\Phi(\theta) \equiv
\int\limits_0^\theta {\rm d}\phi\; 
{\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\phi\right) \ln \left(2 \cos {\textstyle{\frac{\phi}{2}}} \right) \; , 
\end{equation}
which obeys the following symmetry property:
\begin{equation}
\label{sym_Phi}
\Phi(\theta) + \Phi(\pi-\theta) 
= \Phi(\pi) + {\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\pi-\theta\right) {\mbox{Ls}}_{2}\left(\theta\right) \;, 
\end{equation}
where 
\begin{eqnarray}
\hspace{-10mm}
\Phi(\pi) & = &  
{\textstyle{\frac{1}{6}}} \ln^4 2 - \zeta_2 \ln^2 2 + {\textstyle{\frac{7}{2}}} \zeta_3 \ln 2 
- {\textstyle{\frac{53}{16}}} \zeta_4 + 4 {\mbox{Li}}_{4}\left(
